fields.headline: Truth-teller Trump: Comey lied
fields.bodyText: At a news conference, Donald Trump declared he was “100%” willing to speak with the special counsel Robert Mueller, “under oath”, about his conversations with the former FBI director James Comey, whom the president accused of lying on Thursday. Comey punched back hard Reporter: You said you hoped the Flynn investigation could be let go? Trump: I didn’t say that. I didn’t say that … I did not say that. Reporter: So if Robert Mueller wanted to speak with you about that … Trump: I would be glad to tell him exactly what I just told you. – from a Rose Garden news conference Friday “Frankly, James Comey confirmed a lot of what I said,” Trump said. “And some of the things that he said just weren’t true.” To review: the president in the Rose Garden accused the former FBI director of lying to Congress under oath. Rightwing media sees win “WOW, Comey is a leaker!” Trump tweeted Friday. At his news conference, Trump summarized Comey’s testimony like this: “No collusion. No obstruction. He’s a leaker.” Trump’s legal team said they would file a complaint against Comey with the justice department. Trump to file complaint This should not be called a leak. The word ‘leak’ refers to revealing secret and classified information. It is a misuse of the term ‘leak’ to apply that in any way to what Comey described in his testimony. – Fordham law school professor Jed Shugerman, to the Guardian After threatening Comey last month with tapes of their conversations, Trump would not say whether he had tapes. “I’ll tell you about it over a very short period of time,” he said. “You’re going to be very disappointed.” Sanders could have won I hardly know the man, I’m not going to say: ‘I want you to pledge allegiance.’ Who would do that? Who would ask a man to pledge allegiance under oath [sic]? I mean think of it. I hardly know the man. It hardly makes sense. – Donald Trump It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest politics news. But good journalism takes time and costs money.
